intro: Daubentonia longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf daubentonia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale green, and it produces small, spherical berries that contain the seeds. Daubentonia longifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
